titles.title: A concurrent resolution expressing the sense of the Congress congratulating the people of Berlin on the occasion of the city's 750th anniversary in the year 1987, commending the people of Berlin for their centuries of great tradition and continuing courage in the face of historical adversity, and recognizing the deep and lasting relations they have with the people of the United States of America.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on Foreign Affairs.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
House Committee on Foreign Affairs Discharged by Unanimous Consent.
Called up by House by Unanimous Consent.
Resolution Agreed to in House by Voice Vote.
Referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.
Senate Committee on Foreign Relations discharged by Unanimous Consent.

vote.text: Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment and with a preamble by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 3/25/1987--Introduced. States that the Congress: (1) congratulates Berlin on its 750th anniversary; (2) commends the people of Berlin for their tradition and courage in adversity; and (3) recognizes the deep and lasting relations Berliners have with the people of the United States.
